page.title: 06ACLE MARKET
page.content: AN IMPORTANT FOCAL POINT OF VILLAGE LIFE IS THE MARKET.IN FACT ,THIS IS REALLY TWO MARKETS IN ONE,BOTH OF WHICH TAKE PLACE EVERY THURSDAY.ONE OF THEM IS ACTUALLY A GENERAL AUCTION,AT WHICH HOUSEHOLD GOODS,FURNITURE,FOOD, BICYCLES AND SO ON ARE SOLD.THE OTHER, LARGER ,MARKET CONSISTS OF FIFTY OR SO TRADITIONAL STALLS,SELLING PRODUCE, POULTRY,TOYS,CLOTHING,BRIC-A-BRAC AND PET SUPPLIES. BOTH MARKETS ARE VERY WELL ATTENDED (AVERAGE FIGURE DURING THE PERIOD OF SURVEY BEING AROUND 5000 PER DAY). STALL-HOLDERS TRAVELLED TO THE 'SALE' (AS THE MARKET IS LOCALLY KNOWN) FROM UP TO 60 MILES AWAY,WHILE CUSTOMERS COME NOT ONLY FROM ACLE ITSELF,BUT ALSO FROM MANY OUTLYING VILLAGES. DURING THE SUMMER THE ATTENDANCE IS SWELLED BY NUMBERS OF HOLIDAY MAKERS, WHO CURRENTLY PASS BY ON THEIR WAY TO
